He was always smiling. We stayed in one of the Valencia Suites. It was very nice but no view. Had it been earlier in the day and not after a 6 + hour flight I would have requested a different room. They were accommodating by bringing in a cot so our boys did not have to share the pull out bed. (although, I did request this a week before when I made the reservations and it was not ready when we got to the room after a long flight from Hawaii, at 11:30pm at night, we had to ask for it and it was brought in promptly) I did have a sneaking feeling that some people who worked there were a bit put off by us having our 3 and 7 yr. olds with us. They all eventually warmed up when they saw how well behaved they were (the kids were too jet lagged to get out of hand, lol) But I did feel as though kids were not welcome. The food was incredible and incredibly priced, but worth the splurge. They do have a great kid's menu also. We ate at the lounge which is more casual and at the main restaurant. When we called to ask about the dress code for the the main restaurant (T. Cooks) they said that it was "resort casual" and they preferred no shorts and did not allow jeans. We pulled out the only pair of pants that my husband brought and ironed them only to see that there were many patrons with shorts on. A little frustrating, but nothing terrible. The only thing that put me off, although it was handled professionally, was when we checked in and went to our room. There was a woman, who was badly bruised, obviously drunk, talking on her cell, smoking on the outside steps of our hallway. This was almost midnight, and we had our very tired children with us. Then when our cot was brought in, she was right outside our room, sitting at a hall desk, leg draped over the table, practically falling off the chair, she was so out of it. When we asked about her and if she was alright, they were very kind saying that she had fell on some bad luck and had been in an accident and was recovering. It was a little off putting mostly because our kids were with us. We also encountered her the next morning at the pool, ordering drink after drink, and she did not look well. After that we were told she was being moved to a different room. I feel like I am nit-picking but when you spend that kind of money and the reputation of the customer service is very high, you tend to look for things wrong. So all in all it was a very pleasant experience. I would love to go there again, maybe without the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: sduarte35
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a night at the hotel. It's my favorite for a reason. The grounds are spectacular and the service is impeccable. The rooms are extremely comfortable and the views are amazing. It truly is a get away from very thing. T. Cook's has incredible food and the Sunday brunch is delicious and reasonably priced. We had a complimntary room at another hotel the nit after our stay and debated staying at the Royal Palms instead, but decided to check out the other hotel. We were only gone an hour and called back to see if they had an available room! The staff welcomed us back & they gave us a fabulously upgraded room. It means a lot when the staff greets you by name after only having met you once. I can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couples get-away, best spa experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: abqtravelgal
Reviews.Content: Sometimes true quality and excellence shines through not only in what was perfect, which is just about everything here, but also in what wasn’t. The staff addressed very loud maintenance right outside our room at a very early hour efficiently and with grace. The term guest really does apply at this property. Some tips for enjoying this gorgeous and tranquil place: 1) If you like sitting on your room patio and soaking in a beautiful view, ask for Designer Casitas 109 or 110. 2) If you are into fitness, the resort has a guest agreement with the Village just about 5 minutes down Camelback. It is a fabulous facility with tons of classes. Try the Gentle Yoga. The fitness center at the resort is very small. 3) Get a spa treatment. This is the most serene spa I have ever been to. 4) Go in the summer. Stay a 3rd night for free. It’s really not that hot. 5) The resort is really much more appropriate for adults than kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: actressmom99
Reviews.Content: This is a special place - serene and lush property, wonderful staff and lovely rooms. Staff goes the extra mile when you make a request. The food at the restaurant is outstanding and very good value. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and business accommodations were 2nd none”
Reviews.Author: legovel
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay and every individual who attended the meeting, up to and including the VP indicated it was the best place they'd attended a meeting of the kind we conducted (regional business reviews)

Reviews.Title: “Serenity Now was my mantra for this much needed trip and that's what I received. Thanks all! I will return ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: trishrc
Reviews.Content: The spa was completely amazing. I felt solitude even though there were others receiving treatments. It was peaceful, calm and the staff (Lisa, Lisa Marie, Nicki and Sasha) was so professional and so good at what they do. I felt a kindness and caring from each team member (Wendy and Meagan's welcome). I melted into the furniture and experienced a peace and calm that I hadn't for years. Thank you to the whole team. I will be singing your praises to everyone I know!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: tatiana27
Reviews.Content: It's my first public review, usually have no time, no wish, etc. But this Hotel is something special , can't stand to say a few words. Really perfect in everything. And really calming atmosphere. If we plan someday to visit Arizona again, no doubt we'll stay only here. Highly recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: JodieBrownlee
Reviews.Content: It's a spanish style converted mansion and has all the trappings to make you feel like an honoured guest. Every little nook and secret courtyard was a masterpiecefrom the hand painted chests, to the fruit garden. Service was friendly and efficient. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Flawless service above all else”
Reviews.Author: RovingCanucks
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, the driving force of the Palms is service. Most staff remember your name and whatever whim you have is readily met. Rooms are spacious and clean. Bed was very comfortable and there is both a large soaker tub and stand up shower in most rooms. Numerous pathways through the resort - including a garden area with fruit trees - always easy to find a quiet place to relax. The pool, while small, is located in the center of the resort and has direct sunshine almost all day. Numerous umbrellas are available for shade and a wave of your hand brings immediate attention for food or drinks. While certainly not the cheapest option in Phoenix, if you value impeccable service and want a sunny location, you cannot miss. Finally, limo service is available to the nearby Scottsdale malls and Old Town for $10-20.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and the staff waited on us hand and foot!”
Reviews.Author: efletch3
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a quick vacation with my wife and was greeted with helpful and friendly valet and reception staff. The bellboy helped us to our room and kept up friendly conversation as well as ensuring our room was stocked with some ice and too our liking. My wife enjoyed the Alvadora Spa while I investigated the grounds. They were beautifully maintained with lots of rabbits running around. We enjoyed the pool (it does get very cool after the sun goes down, even during June) and there is a cabana bar open from 11 to 6 and serves drinks and food. We were staying in one of the Valencia Casitas, which was a beautiful and spacious room equipped with a mini-bar, living room set, robes, safe, and vanity set. There are interconnecting doors between the Casitas, which are great for parties staying together, but unfortunately are not very sound proof. We had dinner at T.Cooks Restaraunt on the property and were pleased to learn that the head chef had competed on Iron Chef and the food was amazing. The later check-out time allowed us to sleep in and check out was as easy as check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Know What All the Fuss is About?!?”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal Palms for the Lamborghini Giro and was quite disappointed mainly because of high expectations. The room and service were both mediocre for a hotel of this caliber.... Returning to Scottsdale, I would definitely stay at Sanctuary or Hyatt Gainey Ranch which are both superior in every regard. The only bright spot to the stay was the food, both dinner and breakfast at T. Cooks. Otherwise, I certainly couldn't tell you why others regard this as the best hotel in Scottsdale - Maybe, they've never stayed in a Casita at Sanctuary?!?

Reviews.Title: “You know it's a nice hotel when there's a Lamborghini convention there”
Reviews.Author: taw3210
Reviews.Content: What an awesome place! I've stayed at numerous high-end hotels/resorts. This is one of the most quaint and cozy resorts I've ever experienced. The staff was truly amazing in their friendliness and cheerful attitude. At some high-end spots, the staff puts off an arrogance that is irritating -- not here. The room was very spacious, well decorated. Nice to walk in with relaxing music playing and soft lighting. The bath was especially spacious. The concierge went out of her way to assist with golf arrangements. The number of high-end resorts in the Phoenix area is overwhelming, but this should be on the very short list of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: snasp
Reviews.Content: Will not write a detailed review, because everything I have to say has already been said in other reviews of this fine property. The ambiance oozes charm and comfort and the employees (each and every one!) make this resort exceptional. This was my first time vacationing here, but will definitely not be the last. Royal Palms Resort is my new favourite place.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, Lining Up 3rd for Next Year”
Reviews.Author: JMoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms is officially my favorite resort-aside from our fav. on the ocean in Los Cabos (no ocean in Phoenix- can't be helped). Yes, we have been to nicer, more "perfect" resorts- but the bottom line is the service, the grounds and the ambiance at the Palms keeps bringing us back. I said it before- if you can't relax and unwind here- you can't do it anywhere. Around every corner is a bench or garden or trickling fountain or hammock. Poolside staff re-fills your water (and drink order) constantly and the valet staff will remember your name- 1 year later. The rooms are lovely with attention to detail and romance. Yes the pool is too small. Yes there is a resort fee (plainly advertised). But that fee covers valet, gratuities, wireless, newspaper and twice daily room servicing. The pool is open 24 hours- go later and enjoy complete privacy. Its still 80 degrees out after dinner. Most telling to me- the number of Phoenix/Scottdale residents who "staycation" here. They don't go to the Biltmore or the Phoenician- when they want to feel like they are apart and away from the everyday world they go to the Palms. One note if you are deciding what room to book: the spa suites have a full bath, full living room and master bedroom. They are all divisible by large pocket doors. (Great for quiet time). They are modern and clean. The downside: they are in a standard hotel-type wing- which means you can have someone above you or below. If you want to be esconsed in total privacy- book a casita. The rooms aren't quite as nice, but they are very secluded. Its a personal preference. Get to the pool (early), grab a cocktail, have Matt prop up the umbrella to give you shade, and forget the world. (or grab a hammock under the palms and read a book, or watch the bunnies.) I am a full speed-type A-always moving-hotel snob with no patience and no tolerance- I forget it all here.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: AUKTourist
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms and Spa sets out to be the best in the area. It achieves this through a focus on customer service from all members of staff. Whenever an issue arises it is resolved without fuss. The rooms are serviced twice a day and are comfortable and clean. At the pool Jose and the team ensure that you are looked after even pampered throughout your stay. We were there 8 days and had no issues with finding somewhere to sunbathe, the pool team provide you with iced water throughout the day. A perfect gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Say Enough Good Things!”
Reviews.Author: Kara42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal Palms in Scottsdale in May and just loved it! It may be the best hotel experience I've ever had, and that's saying a lot since we live and travel extensively in Europe. The Royal Palms treated us with outstanding customer service and it was obvious that their customers are their number one priority. We booked a casita for a couple of nights and it was roomy and very nicely appointed. The bed was also incredibly comfortable. The grounds are lush and beautiful, and our casita was extremely private and quiet. In the mornings, we had breakfast delivered and the food was excellent, like everything else about this hotel. It really was a perfect stay. When we checked out, the desk clerk asked if there was anything they could have done to improve upon our experience, and our honest answer was no.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service. Beautiful grounds. Peaceful, quiet and comfy.”
Reviews.Author: want2gosomewhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary and loved it. There is a small, boutique feeling to the and it's perfect for a romantic getaway. The rooms are cozy, the service is great, and the entire place is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: crosscreek7
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect. The staff was more than attentive, check in was easy--even though it was a bit crowded, ice tea and water were in the lobby. We arrived half an hour before check in, so we sat in the lovely courtyard and enjoyed our ice tea. The room was just lovely, and I highly recommend the restaurant--less pricey than I had anticipated-- and again, outstanding service, great food and wine. During this time of year, "shoulder season" and summer, look for special deals. The rates are considerably lower, but the quality is still excellent. Additionally, golf rates are extremely reasonable, even top ranked courses

Reviews.Title: “Short but sweet visit.”
Reviews.Author: candice53
Reviews.Content: I regret that we couldn't stay longer. Our stay was brief but we enjoyed the grounds immensely. The scent of jasmine filled the air and I was in heaven! Our Valencia Casita room (not suite) was comfortable and had a nice patio area to enjoy. I was not fond of the bathroom set up though. A standard tub had a large shower head but poor water pressure. There was not a single hook in the toilet/bath area to hang a robe or clothes, I found that odd and inconvenient. The resort did supply robes, but I found them rather scratchy and uncomfortable. I don't mean to deliberately find fault, but my expectations were very high. I agree that the pool is small, but most guests seemed to just lounge by it....not really use it. The lounge area is very tightly packed with exceptionally comfortable lounge chairs. Although others seem to rave about the pool service, we found it to be just mediocre. Despite a few short comings and disappointments, I look forward to returning to this hotel someday to enjoy the very beautiful surroundings at more length.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds and rooms”
Reviews.Author: debuyama
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation with our 8-month old, and we wanted to go some place warm with a pool where we could relax. The Royal Palms Resort surpassed our expectations. They had a crib waiting in our Valencia Suite when we arrived with baby creams and powders. While the pool is small and you have to grab chair early in the morning if it is crowded, the staff at the pool is AMAZING. Jose and Will who were the pool attendants while we were there worked their butts off filling everyone's water glass and made sure everyone had plenty of ice and a slice of orange in each drink. They will open up the shade tents and continue to move them through the day to keep the sun just off your chair. These guys certainly earn their tips. While we did stay here with our 8-month old and while the staff made us feel welcome, there were not many other children. The Royal Palms is definitely an adult get away, and the pool scene is quite with readers and sleepers. The spa was super expensive so my wife bailed on getting a massage. We got a super great rate given the off season stay, but the one thing that really bugs me is the $28/day "Resort Fee" which is crazy, just include this in your price b/c this is not an optional item.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: pamelaNewportBeach
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights. The service staff were spectacular. Everyone knew our name and seemed to do everything in their power to meet our every request. At the pool, the staff filled our glasses with water as soon as empty and they were more than happy to move umbrellas to provide shade. Our spa treatment was wonderful as well. One confusing element was the tipping policy. At check in, we were told that the daily resort fee covered tips. However, the service was so spectacular that we felt guilty not tipping. The grounds are beautiful and well cared for. We have stayed in many beautiful hotels worldwide and the Royal Palms beats them all for service and peaceful leisure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place! Our fourth stay, and not our last!”
Reviews.Author: Bottlerocket9
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Royal Palms four times since 2003, most recently in April 2011. The Royal Palms exceeded our expectations each time. We celebrated our anniversary there this year. If you like being steps away from the pool, the spa, the restaurant, your car... yet at the same time in a private, elegant resort..this is the place for you. It is designed as a destination, so you could stay on grounds the whole time if your goal is to relax by the pool and get spa treatments. But we also took day trips, and the concierge was excellent in helping us plan then. The pool service, valet, and bell staff were like none other. Your water glass was always filled with ice water, no order from pool side was too much, and they were always willing to please. At poolside, Jose especially was exceedingly pleasant, helpful, and professional. He was always there to ask if we wanted something. When we went out at for our day trips, the valets had our car available virtually instantly..within a minute or two of us asking. Everyone we met was pleasant and helpful, and was patient in answering our questions and responding to our requests. Our room, and many others, opened up onto a large patio area with a fountain, reflecting pool, and gas fire pits with many places to relax. There are many cozy 'nooks' to sit and relax. The spa treatments were great (I'd need to write a separate review to tell you about them). The Royal Palms is right off busy Camelback Road, but you'd never know it. There is a long palm tree lined driveway which sets it back from the road, and gives the Royal Palms an immediate, elegant feel. It was very quiet, and you immediately feel calm and comfortable. I think the proximity to Camelback Road is a real plus; it means you can easily go on day trips. Also, the Royal Palms was less than a 30 min drive from the Phoenix airport. I'd recommend eating breakfast at T Cooks, lunch at the pool, a day trip, and then dinner at T Cooks. After dinner, sit by the fountains and the outdoor fireplace, and enjoy a nice drink. The Royal Palms is not a large hotel (I'm not sure of the number of rooms. I'm sure their website would have that information). The feel is very personal and feels customized to your needs. The T. Cooks restaurant is on grounds, and serves excellent food. I believe it is a top ranked restaurant in the Phoenix area in its own right. You can eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner there. The Royal Palms is not your 'big box' type destination. Although children are welcome there, it would probably not be the place for large groups with lots of children to entertain. If you are celebrating something like an anniversary, its a wonderful place. Or if you need a relaxing getaway, you can't do better than the Royal Palms. It would also be a great place to go with other couples. I recommend the Royal Palms without reservation. This was our fourth visit, but certainly not our last!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Romantic, Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tookie624
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Royal Palms from April 2 to April 8th. The hotel is just lovely with plantings, fountains, and fruit trees everywhere. It is very small which is great because everyone knows your name. It really personalizes your trip. When we were there, there were many outside groups for either weddings or meetings or banquets taht occupied many of the spaces. This could be annoying when some of those guests became loud or intrusive. But other than that we had a lovely stay there. I can't say enough about Jose. Jose was the pool valet. I have never seen anyone work as hard. He greeted us by name everyday often asking us how our plans from the previous day worked out. Every request was fulfilled with a smile. He didn't stop for a minute. Equally wonderful were the men who valeted the car. They always offered directions and advice. No matter how busy they were, they too greeted us by name. Royal Palms is a bit quiet. Not much to do during the week. It is a bit confusing as to what the resort fee covers. But what it may lack in activities, it more than makes up for it with some of the best customer service I have ever had. If they could clone Jose and the guys who valet, they could really teach some other better known resorts a thing or two.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect sunny weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: sfmonica
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property with the perfect amenities for a weekend away. Pool was small-ish, but loungers & service were great. The hotel was BOOKED when we stayed there, but it never felt crowded and it didn't impact service. Rooms are lovely- we stayed in the "lowest level" room and it was fantastic. We used concierge services for taxis, towncars (comparably priced to taxis), recommendations, & spring training tix and they were great. Eventhough we arrived at 2am due to a delayed flight they made everything as comfy as possible. We enjoyed room service and dining at T.Cooks. I would say the only (maybe) negative is that it is not in/near a walking neighborhood in Scottsdale. I like exploring and would have enjoyed that proximity, but the car service was super easy. I would definitely stay here again. I booked on Hotwire and got a room here when their website said they were sold out. Floor/ceiling walls were a bit thin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, be careful though with rooms close to the carpark very noisy”
Reviews.Author: disport
Reviews.Content: First thing is there are some great things about this place, the wonderful staff, the spa, the amazing food (even room service) and the most comfortable bed I've ever had in a hotel. There's a few things though, the resort has added more rooms to the property so the pool area is tiny compared to the number of guest (especially when the conventions come out of break) so it's not very relaxing. It needs a second pool area. There is also a wing of rooms that overlook the car park and the main road that don't have balconies, we were unlucky enough to get one of these. That wing is also 2 stories high and the noise from the upper floor was unwelcome especially the plumbing. You also get woken up by delivery trucks below and lawnmowers. Our friends had one of the newer rooms with a fireplace. Make sure you get one of those.

Reviews.Title: “The most peaceful place I know.”
Reviews.Author: DebS142
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms is my most favorite place to visit! From check in to check out our stay is always a 100% delight! The Boutique feeling is awsome and the customer service is second to NONE! Even at the pool, if you need shade, they will make shade for you! Always a full glass of water with fresh fruit and anything else you need to enjoy your time at the pool! The Spa is just as awesome! The restaurant is awesome too! The views of Camelback both at day or night is unbelieveable. This place just puts us in another world! Every time we check out we can't wait to visit again! We hear certain music and are immediately transported back to the Palms! Just really love it there! It is our special place!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, perfect for a girls getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: hlcoughlin
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we were blown away by this beautiful property! The property is absolutely gorgeous, and the staff is AMAZING! Everyone was so attentive and the staff looked like they were having fun at all times, which only makes it that mch better for guests. Specifically the service at the pool was amazing, coming from the east we did quite a bit of sun worshipping out there and Jose at the pool was so fantastic! He was always running to help someone and did it with such a great attitude. We used the weekend as a girls getaway and truly loved enjoying the spa, the retaurant and pool area. The spa was phenomenal, request a room with a view!! It was so relaxing and then after your treatment make sure there is time to enjoy the sanctuary, hot tub and steam room! T. Cooks was fantastic, our waiter led us through th experience and helped us to select an amzing meal. I have an allergy and opted out of dessert, since there was not much for me, to avoid my feeling left out he brought me something spcial from the kitchen which was thoughtful and generous. I can not say enough about how wonderful this property was!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: goldenjasper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Scottsdale over the three day weekend in February. We chose this hotel based off the great reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the staff is wonderful! We have stayed in many top hotels with the four seasons being our favorite -- The Royal Palms Resort is just as good! I got a massage at the spa and it was wonderful! The spa is gorgeous and there are so many amenities it was hard to chose where to relax. I would definitely recommend staying here. There is a $28 a day "resort fee" but since we rented a car and were in and out of the hotel it was well worth the price as you do not have to tip the staff (although they deserved extra!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding Anniversary Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: MemoryMaker2011
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms is my new favorite place and probably the best well kept secret in Phoenix. I read all of the reviews on TripAdvisor when planning my anniversary getaway and can honestly affirm the positives. It is worth the money for rest and relaxation. When traveling from Sky Harbor Airport, you will want to get clear driving directions. We missed 2 turns, but once I finally broke down and had my wife ask for directions, we found it. Now that we have been there, it is easy to find on Camelback Road (but you will not find any signs along the way). Once on the property, we found ourselves in a different world. The reception staff welcomed my wife and me with a smile and accommodated us with an early check-in. We enjoyed an awesome Sunday Brunch at T. Cook’s (make reservations well in advance). Our Estate Room was a little dark for reading, even with all the lights on, but very comfortable and quiet which more than made up for it. The grounds are beautiful with orange and grapefruit trees and fountains and fireplaces and seating areas around almost every turn. What really differentiates Royal Palms is the intimacy of being in a smaller resort. Guest services were A+. Dinner at T. Cook’s was delicious (sit outside under the stars near the fireplace if you can). The Lounge was cozy. The Pool service was superb! Try the fish tacos – so good! Fruit and cold water was a nice touch in the fitness room. The hot tub was relaxing. The main pool was heated. The Alvadora spa rejuvenated my wife (try the “Tempting Trio”). Take a morning drive/walk around Camelback Mountain, which is a short distance away and the background setting at the Royal Palms. This place is a photographer’s paradise. Check out was a nice experience, with no surprises on the bill. This is not your kids’ kind of place. Take the entire family to one of the big resorts with multiple pools and structured programs if you’re into that type of experience. But for a special occasion for you and your spouse, you cannot go wrong in choosing the Royal Palms. It is first class. People are great. Prices are fair for the value. I highly recommend it and long to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Escape From The Ordinary to The Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: Des1Edmonton_Alberta
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an experience versus simple accomodation the Royal Plam Resort and Spa is an excellent escape from the ordinary. From the moment you arrive with attentive bell boy service to the moment you depart reluctantly you will feel as though you have had an extradordinary experience. My visit was a special weekend planned with my teenage daughter for our birthdays. The resort grounds is stunning, lots of palm trees, orange trees and vegetation that make you feel like you have escaped the city. Besides the pool, with cabanas, outdoor cafe, and lots of sitting areas in various spots in the garden like grounds the Spanish Colonial architecture transports you to another time. Our room was a Valencia Casita with antique looking wooden doors, wooden shutters and tiled bathroom. The 4 poster bed with curtains provided an added royal feel to the accomodation. Unfortunately for us it rained during our weekend so we never truly got to sit outside on our private deck area, or any of the poolside spots but we did turn on the electric fireplace and enjoy room service. The restaurant TJ Cooks is great - I ordered lemon filled french toast and I must say it felt decadent as it was like eating cake for breakfast. We did the girls weekend package so we had a spa treatment included and this was wonderful. Truly an escape filled with relaxation and serenity. The attention to detail in service and style is outstanding. Location was good for us as we did not drive in Phoenix so relied on cabs to shopping malls and the airport. Depending what else you plan on doing the resort is a great location to feel like you got away and got pampered. What comes with this extraordinary experience is a higher than norm price. For us it was a splurge so plan on a budget that includes taking advantage of at least one spa treatment, and a meal or two at the restaurant. If you don't care about what your room looks like, or the setting of your accomodation you can easily book a less expensive room, but if you want something worth remembering, want to creat a special memory and feel pampered and a real escape weekend then I higher recommend you plan to vist this resort for it was truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Tmba
Reviews.Content: Our family visited Phoenix only to go to Alice Coopers restaurant, we stayed a couple of nights as we didn't really know what Phoenix has to offer. if I lived in the USA, every year I would stay at Royal Palms Resort for at least 2 week. It is absolutely beautiful, Mona is absolutely thorough, helpful, lovely and efficient. The resort is stunning, clean, romantic, spacious, beautiful grounds, beautiful buildings, beautiful scenes. I can not make one fault at all, but anyone going to the USA or within USA should stay here at least once every year for at least a week. It was the most outstanding memory of our month trip in the USA. Do yourself a favour, make this the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Scottsdale or Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Stacypay
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been the favorite in AZ for some time and for good reason. It is the hotel of choice for many famous people. . . both the President and Beyonce have stayed here. It is unbelievable really. It's a quiet retreat with a top notch restaurant nestled into Camelback mountain. T Cook's is delicious. The chef is widely known in the industry and has been seen on Iron Chef. I could eat there everyday really. Try the Brussels! There are many different types of rooms that very in size and construction date. I've stayed in a couple and they each have their own charm. The common grounds are serene with fountains and outdoor seating. The spa has a wide range of services. The hotel and restaurant staff are committed to excellence. Only one word of caution really. . make sure you have a car. You can not walk to anything. It is kind of in a residential area.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Palms slipping?”
Reviews.Author: billyfitness
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds? -Yes. T.Cooks, one of the best restaurants in the country on the property? -Awesome. Having a car service on the property always ready to go? -Very convenient. Beautiful view of Camelback? -Fantastic And...Quiet, Comfy, Laid Back, Un-crowded Unexpected and Unforeseen Problems: - Forgot to make-up our room one day. - Charging $28 resort fee is cheap and demeans the value of a 5 start hotel - Charging $.50 per minute for internet service, also cheap - Reserving tables for up to 8 people in the lounge for non-guests is not cool - On going to the Spa to use the steam, etc. and asking for a robe, I was denied because I was not having services that day. Other than that, this is a very romantic, quiet, and secluded getaway. T.Cooks, its lounge, staff, food, and wine list are spectacular. A perfect option to avoid a large hotel/resort. I would return and the problems I noted could easily be rectified if management indeed checks out reviews...and listens!

Reviews.Title: “Great mini-vacation with hubby and two teenaged nieces - we loved everything!”
Reviews.Author: xtacine
Reviews.Content: What more can be said that hasn't already been mentioned in the reviews about Royal Palms? The service is top notch, the rooms are lovely (a BIG plus for the fireplace) and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. We stayed in adjoining Valencia casitas. We were told that the bathrooms were redone - ours was interesting, with two showerheads, but no settings for various jet sprays. We had some great meals at T. Cook's - they even catered to my vegan niece! Alvadora Spa was luxurious and wonderful - all three of us ladies enjoyed our treatments. My only minor quibble would be with the fitness center - it was minute, plus no recumbent bike, only treadmills and ellipticals. We were there alone, but it could get crowded very fast. It wasn't as warm in Phoenix as we thought, but we made up for it by staying in the sun as much as possible. Yes, we would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: CarolMChung
Reviews.Content: I have always said that service at the Four Seasons is the best. The Royal Palms and Spa is now on the same playing field in my eyes. From the moment my friends and I arrived at the hotel, it was first class service all the way through. I loved the small gestures. Water with lemon delivered when we sat down by the pool to the valet guys running to get our car enough though we weren't in a rush. The resort itself is lovely. With orange trees lining the resort, the yummy T. Cook's restaurant, and beautiful grounds, we couldn't have picked a more perfect weekend getaway from the cold. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, romantic wonderful get-away”
Reviews.Author: BAMBIBEAR
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Royal Palms many times and always enjoy this secluded and elegant resort, nestled under the Camelback Mountains. The rooms, ambiance, service and special attention to detail are what makes the resort such a success and keeps us coming back. T. Cook's Restaurant is charming and has fabulous food and service. A must stay when you are in the Phoenix area or just want a get away from your existing location. We travel up from Tucson and never regret the journey.

Reviews.Title: “A Mini Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mkaufman
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend after our wedding here. The staff was amazing and made us feel special. We enjoyed every moment. They had breakfast in bed, massages, and a beautiful pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful place with great service”
Reviews.Author: Beccabunny
Reviews.Content: My hubby took me here when he proposed to me. It's was amazing. The rooms are very clean and cute. Comfy beds, nice tv, cute bathrooms and very nice patio. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: CanucksTraveller
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business event, but since the event lasted for quite a few days, my husband came along too. The resort was simply beautiful and had a great romantic and comfy ambiance of being at a villa. It was great for the business event with not too many people, and I would say this is the place to be for a romantic time away or honeymoon. We stayed in a casita (like a detached bungalow) among Valencia orange trees. Everything inside and outside was tastefully done. Besides all that, the service from every staff that we met, including valet, reception, cleaning and gardening staff, bartender and so on, was so professional and service-oriented. They remind me of real guest service which I have not experienced for a very long time. I hope I don't have to say more beyond this... By the way, I also visited the Phoenician hotel - the real luxurious grand hotel down the road. It was beautiful and stunning - I was also impressed. The view from the steakhouse on the 4th (?) floor was amazing at night. If you are more into the grand luxurious posh style, it may be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, when I die...is this heaven? Almost”
Reviews.Author: croapino
Reviews.Content: Wow, when I die...is this heaven? Almost The grounds of Royal Palms is heavenly and the casitas are very well appointed. You cannot hear a peep from the outside, once you close your door. The entire staff is super friendly - almost cult-like, in a good way. The pool is small, but peaceful - the poolside servers are always there with your ice water w/ lemon. Order the Royal Palmer, which is their house cocktail. Very refreshing, yet strong. Downside of the pool ambiance is the staticky radio. For a place like Royal Palms, you would think they would install a better sound system with some down tempo music in loop. Other downside is their pillows - too soft and flat. I kept meaning to call the front desk to ask for firmer pillows. I'm sure they would have some. Other than that - The Royal Palms is pretty close to perfect, sans any car envy when your Honda Insight is sandwiched between a Lambo and a Ferrari.

Reviews.Title: “For a luxury hotel, the service is unacceptable. I will never stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: smhb1122
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had planned a "baby moon" get away weekend to relax (four months after the birth of our first child). I had specifically reserved the Alvadora Spa Terrace Suite for our 2 night stay at the Royal Palms. While waiting at the airport for our flight to Phoenix I decided to ask the hotel if they had an available crib for the room. I was told that they did, yet they could not guarantee that one would be available. I thought to myself, "no problem, we have a travel bed anyway". Upon arrival at the hotel I was told that cribs were "not allowed" in the suite that I had reserved and was asked by Ashley at the front desk if I wanted to change rooms. Ashley offered the following: -- our original suite w/o a crib, a downgrade to a casita for two nights w/ a crib or a comparable suite for one night and then we would have to move to a casita for the 2nd night due to availability. I stated that I wanted our original room as I was not interested in a downgrade or having to move rooms when we were only going to be there for 2 nights. Ashley then told me that she had actually given our Terrace Suite away in the last 3 hours since I called regarding the crib. I explained that at a hotel of this calibre I would have expected a phone call prior to giving our room away. Shouldn't the paying customer have the right to decide if they want their reserved suite or not? What right did she have to give our suite away that I had specifically reserved months before AND they could not even guarantee a crib AND the hotel never stated that cribs were not allowed in that particular suite (which I still don't understand). The weekend only got worse: --Ashley was rude and implied that children were not welcome by statements such as " these rooms really aren't designed for pack-n-plays and stuff like that" (which I had none of by the way). -- Ashley lied about the availability of our suite and tried to convince us to take another room. -- The crib that she claimed she had already arranged for was not delivered until 9:45 pm (2.5 hours after our arrival). -- Our "welcome amenity" that was part of our package was not ready upon arrival either and was not delivered until 9:00 pm (although at 7:30 they told us they would be "right back" with something for us). -- They asked what newspaper we would like and then delivered a different newspaper -- The spa gave my facial appointment away to another guest "by mistake" and given that they only had one person doing facials that day I had to wait almost 1 hour before I could receive my treatment. On a positive note, the manager at the front desk was extremely apologetic and removed Ashley from the situation. The manager compensated us for our spa services and one day of food while at the pool. The pool and restaurant staff were both very polite and professional. Unfortunately, too many things went wrong for us to stay at the Royal Palms again.

Reviews.Title: “My high expectations were exceeded.”
Reviews.Author: ARheaven
Reviews.Content: Had a business trip to Phoenix. Selected the Royal Palms based on reviews. Stayed three nights and received a reasonable internet rate. I had high expectations going in and the hotel exceeded them. I'd go back to Phoenix just to stay there again. A wonderful oasis. Saturday breakfast buffet by the pool was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Ohh~La~Laaaa”
Reviews.Author: LindaRan
Reviews.Content: Ohhhh~Laaa~Laaa Baby. want to impress your significant other? Um, ya, this is "IT". From the gorgeous drive into the tiny circular driveway, where guys hop to your vehicle immediately, to the tiny & intimate little archway into the little cozy 'front's' room, you are transported to a Mediterranean Dream World. Fabby Lounge Outdoor dinning Romantic Dinning. Amazing Courtyard Winding passageways Awesome soaker Tubs Serene Outdoor Yoga Beautiful Gurgling Fountains Interesting Nooks & Crooks in every turn. A+++

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AZMomandWife
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed in one of the beautiful suites on the gorgeous grounds of The Royal Palms. The staff were very friendly and attentive! Our suite was spectacular with a wonderful huge soaking tub with candles and relaxation CDs to set the mood. We had 2 sets of french doors from the sitting area and the bedroom with spectacular view of Camelback Mountain and the pool area. T. Cooks had marvelous food and ambience. We went to the lounge one evening and listened to live music with a gentleman playing the guitar and a lovely young lady singing. I had an amazing massage by Carol one morning, and the grounds just bring you back in time. I cannot say enough of our experience!! Would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly78
Reviews.Content: Can't reccomend this place enough. Fantastic, beautiful room. Incredibly attentive service. And all for just $150 (ok, it was off season, but still...)

Reviews.Title: “Like being in Tuscany for a night”
Reviews.Author: Hojomom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Tempe, only about 20 minutes from this resort, but it felt like we were a million miles away. This resort is so beautiful, as soon as you walk on the property you instinctively take a deep breathe and relax. We had one of the alvadora spa rooms and it was beautiful. I was amazed at the tiny details that they made special like organic coffee in the rooms and bottles of water with turndown. Every piece of furniture, painting, even the coffee condiment box in the room were obviously carefully thought about and perfect for the decor and ambiance. The staff where wonderful and friendly. We had breakfast at T Cooks, the eggs benedict and the biscuits and gravy and everything was fantastic. It was a wonderful escape from everyday life. With two toddlers we don't get away like this often and this was the perfect night off. I would absolutely go here again, hopefully for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating our personal romantic endeavors at the Royal Palms Resort & Spa was the PERFECT choice!”
Reviews.Author: mirage11
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay experience at this historical setting proved the spirit lives on. We felt like celebrities (from the amazing food at T. Cook’s restaurant to the housekeeper’s turndown service) because every staff member really took ownership to enhance our experience. It’s authenticity and impeccable service confirms why this resort wins so many awards. If you want the royal treatment with an intimate atmosphere that blends into the base of the famous Camelback Mountain, we highly recommend this elegant resort. It’s a dream come true!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: perryfamilyAZ
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful stay at the Royal Palms. This is one of the most romantic resorts I've ever been to. The service is excellent. TCook's is a great romantic dinner experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed experience!”
Reviews.Author: Boykins11
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced a more exceptional stay at a resort than the one at the Royal Palms. This was my 3rd visit in 3 years and consistently, each time, truly exceptional. Every aspect of my experience, from the service to the resort offerings were absolutely perfect! The staff is dialed in at every level. Everyone can enjoy this resort. While there are many enormous resorts in the area with lots of ways to help you spend your money, the Royal Palms is much more concerned about YOU and your comfort and experience and will remember you by name, by room number and what your preferences are. Above all, the staff at the pool, the housekeepers, the valet service and T Cook's staff, every associate you come in contact with is anticipating your next need. Incredible. Not to mention this intimate historical property is exquisite and the attention to detail cannot be matched at any of the larger resorts in the area. Value to the experience is a 10! Do not overlook this experience when staying in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. It's close to everything you need, if you must leave the resort for anything. Concierge team can arrange anything for you. A must stay, in my discriminating book.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal Palms Resort and Spa carry you to a time of luxury, service, and an oasis!”
Reviews.Author: mgshaughnessy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the resort our every wish was carried out with respect, cheerfulness, and made us feel like we were royalty! There has never been a hotel/resort that could match the beauty and luxury in everything from well appointed suites to T.Cook's Restaurant, with outside amenities such as the pool and spa area along with services that we found provided at the Royal Palms. We will be sure to be return visitors and recommend the resort to everyone we know. Royal Palms is like a jewel in the desert to be found at the base of Camelback Mountain and enjoyed by everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: jboyer6
Reviews.Content: The Royal Palms Resort and Spa is an incredible establishment. Ever employee has a great personality and really strives to remember the smallest of details to make the trip unforgettable. I didn't want to leave because of the service. The arrival was real great with the bell/valet. Those guys have great attitudes and a great combined knowledge of the valley. The front desk worked very hard to make sure I had the best room for my needs. And the room was perfect. Very comfortable music playing as I walked into my room. The restaurant is easily one of the best in the country. I don't know how people can go to Phoenix and not eat at T. Cook's. If you enjoy Mediterranean food, there is none better in the whole country. The service in the restaurant is top-notch as well. I don't know how they train such a good staff but it's done at the Royal Palms. The place is flawless. Thank you everybody at the Royal Palms for an unforgettable stay. I will be back on numerous occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Celebration!!”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Scottsdale, AZ. For a surprise birthday celebration this year, I decided to take my husband to the Royal Palms for his birthday. We have always loved the hotels restaurant T. Cooks and I knew he would enjoy having dinner there on his birthday plus the resort always was a place we wanted to stay. I booked a Valencia King Suite for 2 nights. Upon arrival we were taken on a tour of the resort and then to our room. What a beautiful room! We had a huge sitting area with a nice wet bar stocked with tea and coffee. The bathroom was gorgeous. A free standing bathtub and a huge shower. Plenty of counter space and a private commode area. The bedroom was wonderful and peaceful. Great bed and so comfortable. Breakfast at T. Cooks was amazing! I had the PB&J with bananas Bread Pudding...So, so good (and I was way stuffed but it was totally worth it). My husband had the pancakes and said they were excellent too. After breakfast we went to the spa for a couples massage. One of the best massages we ever had (we indulge with massages quite a bit, so we have had many). We spent the rest of the day at the beautiful pool and then T. Cooks for dinner, as always it was perfect. We are going to plan on returning next year birthday or not...we could not believe we were so close to home. The Royal Palms staff and their level of service is impeccable. Definitely stay at the Royal Palms when you visit Phoenix, it is by far the best resort around!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service but beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: LovemyAcura
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! We stayed here in the Camelback Inn villa to celebrate my hubby's birthday. We ate lunch and dinner at T Cooks. To begin with we were promised a quiet table for the celebration and were put in between these loud business men and a couple playing with the sounds on the cell phone. It says on the menu that cell phones should be turned off during dinner but that is not enforced. Distracting and annoying to say the least. I tried to make a spa reservation but couldn't get one until the next morning at 11 - checkout is 12 My husband has a brain injury and could stay in the room alone but no where else in the hotel without me. . The front desk first said it might be possible and to call in the morning. But when I called in the morning they said no late checkouts were being given. When I explained the situation they couldn't have cared less. They actually had big smiles on their faces and smirked when I checkout out! We have traveled all over the world and never been treated like that. His disability was ignored and I felt insulted. The room itself was beautiful and we spent about $1000 for that one night and meals. Too bad I felt like we were treated poorly. I'll never return again. I cannot believe this is rated #1 - no way.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service but noisy traffic”
Reviews.Author: allenpenn
Reviews.Content: Most of the service received was 5-star. The woman who checked us explained our room as one type and then gave us another type. We were greatly disappointed but we were all tired and just wanted to sleep. The room also had a lot of noticable traffic noise from the busy road outside the windows. The room had no bathtub, but was an extremely spacious and well-furnished suite. I was expecting a quieter room from a 5-star hotel in Phoenix since I have stayed in so many other nicer hotels in that city. I''m very surprised that this hotel is ranked #1..

Reviews.Title: “Bad Review before the Stay”
Reviews.Author: JJS3
Reviews.Content: This may be a first for me. I am writing a review for this Five Star Hotel because I did not stay there. I made a reservation in May for an August 3 night visit for $288 per night. The room came with a $200 resort credit. I asked for an email confimation when I made the reservation. I did not get it and called back July 28th and asked for it again. Did not come after an hour. Called back again and was told it might take an hour. I asked them to fax it to me. The fax (because of dark background on the print out) was unreadable. I called back again and finally got an email confirmation on my fourth request. The email did not contain the $200 resort credit and included a $25 per day resort fee for such "extras" as "fitness center access, daily newspaper, wireless internet and twice daily housekkeeping service" - things which I would expect as a part of the $288 they were already charging per night to stay in a luxury hotel. The only thing listed on their extras that I would care about was a daily newspaper - and I am certainly not paying $25 a day for delivery. I cancelled the reservation and went to a better hotel, with no resort charges, for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: DilleauxL
Reviews.Content: I called to see if they had a special package and their rep spent quite a bit of time answering all my questions to find something to fit our needs. When we arrived, what they provided far exceeded my expectations -- which were already high. The grounds are spectacular and most of the staff treat you as though you are visiting royalty. My only complaint would be about the service in the restaurant. Breakfast was a bit slow and I had to ask for a coffee refill. Once the food got there it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: justinemmapierce
Reviews.Content: Although we were only there for a night the service, environment and room were of the highest standard, do stay here it is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Oasis in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: SSPP73
Reviews.Content: Touted as the most romantic hotel in Phoenix, this resort delivers with gorgeous grounds, brilliant color even during the hottest month, nooks & crannies coaxing exploration, and a cozy pool. What's not so beautiful is the inconsistent service ranging from excellent to fair at best. The valet guys are friendly, fast, and eager to help. Another reviewer mentioned a sense of a "tip mentality" but we didn't experience that. The $25+ daily resort fee covers all tips & gratuities which was published in several areas throughout our stay. We began our 25th anniversary getaway with a couples massage at the resort spa. The massage therapists were fantastic, giving an excellent massage, and were both very professional. Desk staff: the mostly female employees were friendly and professional. But there was a gentleman working the front area who gave an unfriendly vibe and both hubby & I felt we were intruding. I saw him interacting with other guests and noticed his lack of friendliness; he never did crack a smile. Pool: We enjoyed the cozy pool and enjoyed socializing with other guests. Homero did an excellent job refilling ice water and raced around filling food & drink orders. He was very accomodating and a joy. We really missed him the following day as the other staff person was adequate in his role but not outstanding. Fitness room: Small, several treadmills, and a few weight machines. It's open 24/7 but the fruit wasn't fresh and the water containers weren't replenished. Someone should probably check on the freshness of the items from time to time. I worked out at 7:00 a.m. and found it lacking. Room: We booked a casita and it was very lovely. Housekeeping did a fine job keeping our room loving great. T. Cook's: Was really looking forward to an excellent experience and it was good, but certainly not great. The best part of the meal were the desserts, and they were excellent. Be sure to try the chocolate fantasy. Romance quotient: The resort knew we were celebrating our 25th anniversary and spread lovely rose petals on our table at T. Cook's. They also decorated our dessert plates with "Happy 25th Anniversary." Very nice touches. At the pool, newlyweds shared how the resort gave them a rose petal turndown, chocolate strawberries, champagne, and a lovely card. We thought that was fantastic. After dinner, we returned to our casita and found a rose petal turndown, the chocolates, and a card from our friends. I learned later that the resort does note big anniversaries but told me, "your friend beat us to the punch." Oops.... I certainly wasn't expecting the rose petals, etc. but a card from the resort would've been nice. The resort is beautiful and it felt like we weren't in Arizona. But the service was too inconsistent ranging from outstanding to fair. I do hope management recognizes the need for training in customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “NEARLY perfect..highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: JMoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I really hate to give the Royal Palms 4 stars- but I can't give 4.5 on the website. First- the bad: our coffee maker didn't work. The tea maker had a bug in it. The phones kept blinking that we had a message when we never did. Ashtrays around exterior were not cleaned frequently. The fantastic: the Landscaping. Every square inch has gorgeous lush landscaping, gardens, fountains etc.There were fountains, gardens and comfy benches around every nook and cranny. The sheer uniqueness and non-hotel feel. Same as above touched off with antiques, original pieces, re-purposed items like the terra cotta tiles in the drieway, and pretty much about every surface. Though not my style, you can't help but appreicate the attention to detail. This is no way feels like a big resort or bland hotel. (The pool & hot tub are open 24 hours.) The staff. I won't say perfect but the valets and pool staff were excellent. I appreciated the valets and pool staff remembering our name- even if they pronounced it wrong. Bottom line: aside from posting this review, I will quickly forget the small problems. If you can't relax and unwind, or have a romantic getaway here, you can't do it anywhere. Our stay was for our anniversary and we will be back every year.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Scottsdale/Phoenix - and we've stayed at them all”
Reviews.Author: Greg00
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an extended weekend stay at the Royal Palms. We almost stayed at the Gainey Suites (also ranked #1 by TripAdvisor), but am glad we did not. It looks more like an ordinary hotel next to a shopping mall. We returned to the Royal Palms because our last visit (almost 10 years ago) was always a great memory. We've since been to the Phoenician, Hyatt, Camelback, etc. and like Royal Palms the best. The service at the pool is simply outstanding. The staff is tirelessly working to adjust your umbrella, order drinks, or, keep your waters fresh with ice. As soon as you drive down the palm-lined drive, staff immediately jumps out to meet you and open the doors to your car. The pool area, while small, is charming and never felt crowded. We always found two chairs with an umbrella. This is not always the case at much larger resorts. You can easily get a table next to the pool for a great lunch or breakfast too. All shaded, with misters when hot (like it was last weekend). We've traveled all over the world, and The Royal Palms is one of our top places to stay for a relaxing trip. We booked it on Hotwire, and were upgraded to a casita conveniently located next to the pool. I noticed that Gainey Suites was also a #1 ranked hotel, and we drove by to check it out. We're glad we didn't book there, because it looks like any other hotel next to a mall, and they had no food service at the pool. This is where we like to "hang out" - not in a room with a kitchen or breakfast bar. Stay at the Royal Palms - it is the best in value, service, location, and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously consider your options”
Reviews.Author: Billyphx
Reviews.Content: We just finished our Memorial Day weekend stay at the Royal Palms and I am finding it difficult to describe. I suppose that I should start off by saying I would not recommend the Royal Palms unless you are looking for an authentic Arizona experience or you want a boutique resort experience. The pool area is so incredibly small and the rooms are so old that I just can’t see staying here. With that being said, service and dinning really make the entire resort worth considering. If you want clean lines, a modern feel and a general “new” feel, try the Fairmount Princess or the Hyatt at Gainey Ranch which are both 1st class choices I can vouch for. I can also vouch for the Royal Palms, but only in the context of being authentic. It is also worth noting that the Royal Palms location is absolutely perfect. We live here in the Phoenix area and try to have a stay-cation at a local resort at least once a year, so we have stayed at many of the local resorts. I like the other resorts more than the Royal Palms. This was our first time at staying at the Royal Palms. The rooms are divided into two categories, suites and casitas. Within the Casita category there are “Designer Casitas” and “Valencia Casitas”. We stayed in a Valencia Casita which is the older type although the Designer Casitas are in the same type of structure just remodeled and I’m not entirely sure that staying in a Designer Casita would be much different. The Casitas are dark inside. It is by design. These are old adobe buildings that were obviously built to minimize the impact of AZ summers. The ceilings are about 7’ high and each casita is attached to another. They have been tastefully remodeled to maintain a southwest look. Very Santa Fe-ish. The beds are quality and the linens are top notch, high thread count. There is wifi throughout that worked just fine and didn’t cost anything. The TV’s are flat panel, but not high quality. Our room had a really cool “beehive” fireplace and lots of windows with shutters for privacy with a nice little courtyard patio. The bathroom was small and while it may have been modernized at some point, it has fallen behind. The in room safe was the kind that uses a key, and of a pain to have to haul a key around with you…Cars don’t even have keys anymore. The grounds of the hotel are impeccable, Gorgeous, Unrivaled! The pool and pool area are WAY TOO SMALL. If you think you are going to come here to lounge by the pool with ANY privacy then you are looking at the wrong hotel. The fitness center is average. The Spa is very nice (with the exception being that it doesn’t have its own pool). My wife and I each had 90 minute massages. The price for a massage is higher than most other resorts in Scottsdale and at those resorts you get the benefit of enjoying the spa’s private facilities…Not so here. My advice is to stay somewhere else and come here for dinner at T. Cooks.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: oranges8
Reviews.Content: Perhaps we were expecting a good service and were disappointed at the 2 check in staff who were ladies.Somehow, they were unpleasant and we were quite surprised. We have stayed in excellent hotels and resorts throughout the world in our travels and have never experienced such attitudes before in any of the fine hotels and resorts we have stayed.This is the first time. Unfortunately,the first impression with the check in staff was not a good one. When we asked them about a late check out, they said that they will inform us.They never did which was unfortunate as it shows the kind of staff the resort employs. I hope that this review will be read by the resort so that they are aware of the above.All the other staff were courteous and efficient except for the 2 ladies at the front desk.Such a pity. We would still recommend this resort as it is a nice one to relax.

Reviews.Title: “One word to describe my stay : "Ah...."”
Reviews.Author: abp_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I came to the Royal Palms straight after 6 days in Las Vegas for my company's users conference. I kept thinking I was insane to agree to a meeting in Phoenix after this event (where I spent 6 days just running around presenting all day and staying out all night). I traditionally need about a week of detox to feel normal again, after this, but one night at Royal Palms got me back on track. Hands down, the nicest staff ever. They try to anticipate everyone's needs. I checked in around 3 and called the spa...yep! They got me in for a massage where I even got some life coaching! Room service was incredible. They felt so bad that I had lost my voice, they sent extra water on the house. The pool was amazing with a friendly and helpful staff there, as well. The gym was clean and nice and the whole place has such charm. You really do feel like you are staying with some well-to-do friends in the Mediterranean. I would stay at this place again and again. Perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Even before checkout, I was planning a return trip!”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalTouristNYC
Reviews.Content: I knew almost nothing about this hotel before I arrived. I selected it based on convenience. But I was blown away by almost everything about this hotel. FIrstly, the staff was unfailingly polite and great about following up. Secondly, the views of the Camelback were amazing. One of the things I loved about this hotel, and the main reason I want to go back, is that there are so many little nooks and segregated seating areas each with its own individual charm and aesthetic. The food at T. Cooke was great and the server was awesome - after looking at the dessert menu I asked if they just had some cookies since I just wanted a bite of something sweet. She said there wasn't anything on the menu. But she returned a few minutes later with a couple of chocolate biscotties they had in the kitchen... some left over from the staff family meal. Everyone who worked there was like that - always willing to go just a little beyond what was being asked. I got spoiled rotten there. The pool area might be a minor disappointment as it is quite small with limited seating/lay out area. But overall, it was a great experience staying there and one of my best business related hotel stays and can't wait to go back for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: PGA2
Reviews.Content: If you don't enjoy this place .......... stay home. Oh god someone must complain about something here but I don't know what it is. We loved it. Great little place. Amazing restaurant. Breakfast burritto is a MUST. They even gave me the recipe for salsa. Jezzz its good. Sound crazy for a grits loving guy huh? The pool is really nice but they let the nasty people hold chairs early for the sun. No No NO! Good location near Camelback. You must do the hike. If you can, stay here and forget about looking at other places. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: ukienomad
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel!! We checked in and there was flavored water and tea waiting for us. Our bell boy took us to our room (which was a Casita) and showed us where everything was located, how the hotel came about, etc. He was wonderful, pleasant, can't say enough about him. The room was beatufully appointed but it was dark and very small. The back overlooked a wall and they told me the Casita's had amazing views - yes, from the front but not from the back. We stared at a huge wall. My daughter got married there and most of the people complained about how "dark" their room were and how they were going to put their make up on. I was tempted to be moved but decided to just stay there. When I originally called I was going to get the suite but they said that the casitas had better views. Others in our group were upgraded to larger and better rooms and they were happy. My daughter had the honeymoon suite and it was beautiful. My brother got the suite that had 2 fireplaces outside of their rooms...their suite was amazing...they had 5 in their group and they all stayed in the suite. They also charge you a $25.00 resort fee which was supposed to be included when I reserved with hotels.com but they said I had to pay b/c it was NOT included and they would not bend for anything. Had lunch at the swimming pool one day and it was great food and the waiter was so gracious and wonderful. The staff there couldn't do enough for your (except take the $25.00 resort fee off). The wedding was beautiful, the food was exceptional.......we had a fabulous time. We made a great choice to have it here.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service, beautiful grounds, 5+ stars!”
Reviews.Author: BEVAncouver
Reviews.Content: can't say enough good things about the Royal Palms; this is the best run hotel I have ever stayed at. They offer outstanding service, lovely ambience. Jose at the pool, the bell-hop and car valet , mona at concierge, front desk staff, waiter at T. Cooks provided attentive, helpful and sincere service! Loved our room - clean, luxurious. There was a mix up in our booking in that we were 4, with 2 kids, but only a king bed. There were no rooms with two beds available, so w/o questioning who was to blame, they arranged for us to have a complimentary second room. Jose never let's your ice water go empty at the pool - even though this would surely cut into the hotel's beverage sales around the pool. Stayed for 6 nights, and would have happily stayed for six weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend at Royal Palms”
Reviews.Author: aemcneill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful weekend at Royal Palms. The resort is perfect for quick getaways and we felt rested and relaxed at the end of our stay. The resort is quiet and quaint. The resort is a great place for couples, although, we did see quite a few families with young children. The pool was a bit crowded each day, but Scott was terrific at finding open chairs and rearranging so everyone could have a spot in their preference of sun or shade. The service was outstanding not only at the pool, but in the restaurant as well. We stayed in a spa suite and it was beautiful. I highly recommend this resort and we plan to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and ambience”
Reviews.Author: ArgyleNick
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with delightful grounds, frinedly staff and good food. Only drawback is that it is just off a main road - there is no sidewalk so you always have to hire a car and the road can be heard from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the desert!”
Reviews.Author: looking4sun09
Reviews.Content: The staff are what really made our stay special. The pool servers, valet, front desk....they were all very friendly and accomodating! Couldn't have been any better!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant oasis with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: LBGtraveler
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a wonderful stay. The resort is beautiful. We were pleased there were NO "hidden costs" with check out surprises. If you are on a budget, avoid what appears to be a complimentary 2 glass bottle of wine. It is part of the mini service and the usually inexpensive Beringer wine was $38. The best value was the poolside service. Not only was the food tasty but the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST EVER !!!”
Reviews.Author: LadybugPrescottAZ
Reviews.Content: Love it, we go there often and always have the greatest time, the staff is the best, always there and very attentive and friendly, couldn't be any better. The rooms and the gounds make you feel like in some far away place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, old world charm.”
Reviews.Author: Ranny462
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove through the gates, we knew we were in for something very special. Every detail was perfect. The staff was among the best I have experienced. The young men that were in charge of the valet were awesome in giving us the best off the beat dining experiences. The resort was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Desert Oasis”
Reviews.Author: ArtfullySue
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this property! The second time we have stayed here, and it does not disappoint. The rooms are cozy, the beds, very comfortable. The property has wonderful nooks and crannies and the grounds are just beautiful! You feel more like you are at an inn, because it is quaint and not that BIG hotel feel with SO many people around. It is a smaller property, unique place. Love the bar area, and T. Cook's is fabulous! I will go back here again, whenever I get the chance! One of my very favorite places I have ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: mjb98105
Reviews.Content: A very nice boutique place, different from the large resorts like Westin Kierland or Marriott Camelback Inn. Rooms are charming and suite was nice. Rooms a bit noisy (noise from hallway, and upstairs). Being small, it doesn't have the nice fitness center or the amenity of a golf course right there. Watch out because the resort fee does not include long distance calls. I was charged $12 for a two minute call from Arizona to my home state (to their credit, I took it off. Resort fee usually includes long distance in most hotels in my experience).

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Luxury Resort”
Reviews.Author: phantomacct
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Royal Palms Resort & Spa thanks to a gift certificate we had received. We actually live in Phoenix and had been to the Resort's outstanding restaurant (T Cook's) several times, but had never actually stayed at the Resort. We were extremely impressed with the facilities. My wife loved the Spa and we had a superb dinner at T Cook's. We stayed in one of the Casitas (with a fireplace) and enjoyed it immensely. The size and decor was excellent, and definitely had a resort Southwestern feel. The pool area looked nice and felt somewhat heated, although we didn't go in due to our December stay. The landscaping throughout the grounds was immaculately maintained, with nearby Camelback Mountain providing a nice backdrop at sunset. The only negative item (very minor) was the need to do some upgrades to the bathroom (and perhaps buy new towels, which we found thick but not at all absorbent). Ideally located between the Camelback Esplanade/ Biltmore area and Scottdale, we found the Resort to still be quiet at all times. Highly recommended for romantic and relaxing stays.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: George024
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far one of the best I have ever stayed at. To nit pick I would only complain about T. Cook's for dinner. The staff are awesome from the valet attendants, front desk and room service. Catered food at our meetings was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...if only the wireless worked better”
Reviews.Author: austintraveler52
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel for relaxation...beautiful setting, good staff, nice rooms. Would stay here anytime for a brief resite. Only weakness is the hotel has mediocre or worse wireless.....pals of mine were wandering across the property trying to find anyplace where "very low" didn't appear. Only one place--the office--seemed to be even minimaly acceptable. But then, I don;t think this is really a hotel for people who want to be tied to their computer all day....so....

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with great service. Here's some info to help with room selection. . .”
Reviews.Author: suzieboston
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our 30's & 40's, and we stayed here in October for a week. We chose Arizona for our vacation since we really just wanted sunshine, and it was hurricane season elsewhere. We chose this hotel based on TA. The staff were excellent across the board, in all departments. The front desk, valets, pool bartender and restaurant staff were all great. Breakfast was good. We didn't love the food at the T. Cook's restaurant at dinnertime, though, and would suggest eating elsewhere at night. (Also, FYI, we did go one night for happy hour to eat at the bar in T. Cook's, and apparently the price is based on when you finish your meal, not when you order it--we paid full price even though we arrived well within the designated period. We didn't feel like saying anything, though.) The concierge was especially helpful and set up a great day for us in Sedona. The gym is clean, and the equipment is great. As others have mentioned, this place is designed such that you often feel like you have it all to yourself. The grounds are lush and beautiful and really unlike what you would expect in the desert. We first stayed in a Montevista Terrace room. It was new and sparklingly clean, with a very comfy bed and a gorgeous soaking tub. The terrace was not at all private, though, and the room was pretty noisy from people in the hallway. This section is more like a regular hotel. We discussed the possibility of moving at some point during the week to a more quiet and private location, and the staff were very accomodating. They gave us the choice of moving to one of the deisgner casitas, and showed us two of them. They went above and beyond to make sure we were happy with our room. I was really impressed by that, since obviously that didn't have to do that for us. The desinger casitas are not as new or as squeaky-clean, but are more private and tucked away on he property. They have patios in front and in back, with the back ones entirely closed off by a wall for privacy. If you want privacy, this is it. The tubs are shallow and nowhere near as nice as those in the Montevista rooms, and in fact the staff mentioned that as their big drawback. But, the walk-in shower with a skylight is just a nice. Our designer casita did have a couple of other weird drawbacks, though. As another person mentioned, the wooden blinds don't close all the way so this detracts from the sense of privacy a little, and means the room was never dark at night. Also, the AC/heating system turned on and off all night, and each time it started up there was a sound of five taps followed by the sound of rushing air. Ear plugs and a blindfold are a good idea, but light sleepers should just not stay in these rooms.
